api/agents.title: Agents
api/agents.description: Agents are the core autonomous entities in TFrameX that can use tools, maintain conversations, and work together to solve complex tasks. This reference covers all agent types and their APIs.

api/flows.title: Flows
api/flows.description: Flows enable complex multi-agent orchestration by defining how agents work together. This reference covers flow creation, execution, and advanced patterns.

api/mcp.title: MCP Integration
api/mcp.description: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration in TFrameX v1.1.0 provides seamless connectivity to external services, tools, and data sources through a standardized protocol.

api/memory.title: Memory API
api/memory.description: TFrameX provides a simple memory system for storing conversation history. The current implementation focuses on basic storage and retrieval functionality.

api/overview.title: API Overview
api/overview.description: TFrameX provides a comprehensive Python API for building sophisticated multi-agent LLM applications. This reference covers all public APIs, their usage patterns, and best practices.

api/patterns.title: Patterns
api/patterns.description: Patterns are reusable multi-agent orchestration templates that implement common collaboration strategies. TFrameX provides four built-in patterns that can be customized and nested for complex workflows.

api/patterns_old.title: Patterns
api/patterns_old.description: Patterns are pre-built, reusable flow templates that implement common multi-agent orchestration strategies. TFrameX provides several built-in patterns that can be customized for your specific use cases.

api/tframexapp.title: TFrameXApp
api/tframexapp.description: The TFrameXApp class is the central orchestrator of the TFrameX framework. It manages agents, tools, runtime contexts, and provides the main interface for building AI applications.

api/tools.title: Tools
api/tools.description: Tools extend agent capabilities by providing access to external functions, APIs, and services. This reference covers the tool system, creation methods, and best practices.

cli/basic.title: tframex basic
cli/basic.description: The tframex basic command provides an instant interactive AI session with a pre-configured assistant. It's the fastest way to experience TFrameX's capabilities.

cli/commands.title: Command Reference
cli/commands.description: Complete reference for all TFrameX CLI commands and options.

cli/overview.title: CLI Overview
cli/overview.description: The TFrameX CLI provides powerful command-line tools for building, testing, and deploying AI agent applications. With simple commands, you can start interactive sessions, create projects, and launch web interfaces.

cli/serve.title: tframex serve
cli/serve.description: The tframex serve command launches a web interface for your TFrameX agents, providing a browser-based chat experience with REST API endpoints.

cli/setup.title: tframex setup
cli/setup.description: The tframex setup command creates a complete TFrameX project with proper structure, configuration files, and working examples. It's the recommended way to start building production-ready AI applications.

concepts/agents.title: Agents
concepts/agents.description: Agents are the core intelligent actors in TFrameX. They process inputs, make decisions, execute tools, and collaborate with other agents to accomplish complex tasks.

concepts/flows.title: Flows
concepts/flows.description: Flows are TFrameX's way of orchestrating complex, multi-step workflows. They enable you to chain agents, tools, and patterns together to solve sophisticated problems.

concepts/mcp-integration.title: MCP Integration
concepts/mcp-integration.description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration enables TFrameX to connect with external services, tools, and resources through a standardized protocol. This allows your agents to access capabilities beyond what's built into your application.

concepts/memory.title: Memory
concepts/memory.description: Memory systems in TFrameX enable agents to maintain conversation context, recall past interactions, and build upon previous knowledge. This is crucial for creating coherent, context-aware AI applications.

concepts/overview.title: Overview
concepts/overview.description: TFrameX is built on a few powerful core concepts that work together to create sophisticated AI applications. Understanding these concepts will help you build better agents and workflows.

concepts/patterns.title: Patterns
concepts/patterns.description: Patterns are reusable workflow templates in TFrameX that solve common multi-agent coordination problems. They provide structured ways for agents to work together effectively.

concepts/tools.title: Tools
concepts/tools.description: Tools are the bridge between your AI agents and the real world. They enable agents to perform actions, retrieve information, and interact with external systems.

enterprise/configuration.title: Configuration
enterprise/configuration.description: This guide covers configuring TFrameX Enterprise features including security, metrics, storage, and other production settings.

enterprise/metrics.title: Metrics & Monitoring
enterprise/metrics.description: TFrameX Enterprise provides basic metrics collection for monitoring application performance and usage through Prometheus integration.

enterprise/overview.title: Enterprise Overview
enterprise/overview.description: TFrameX Enterprise provides production-ready features for deploying AI agent systems with persistent storage, basic monitoring, and security foundations.

enterprise/security/audit.title: Audit Logging
enterprise/security/audit.description: TFrameX Enterprise provides comprehensive audit logging for compliance, security monitoring, and forensic analysis. Every significant action is logged with full context and tamper-proof storage.

enterprise/security/authentication.title: Authentication
enterprise/security/authentication.description: TFrameX Enterprise supports multiple authentication providers to integrate with your existing security infrastructure.

enterprise/security/authorization.title: Authorization (RBAC)
enterprise/security/authorization.description: TFrameX Enterprise implements a comprehensive Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) system with hierarchical roles, fine-grained permissions, and dynamic policies.

enterprise/security/overview.title: Security Overview
enterprise/security/overview.description: TFrameX Enterprise provides comprehensive security features to protect your AI agent deployments, ensure compliance, and maintain audit trails.

enterprise/security/sessions.title: Session Management
enterprise/security/sessions.description: TFrameX Enterprise provides secure session management with support for multiple backends, concurrent session control, and advanced security features.

first-agent.title: Your First Agent
first-agent.description: This tutorial will guide you through building a complete AI agent from scratch, teaching you the core concepts of TFrameX along the way.

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: This guide covers all the ways to install and set up TFrameX for your projects.

intro.title: Introduction
intro.description: TFrameX is a production-ready Python framework for building sophisticated multi-agent LLM applications. Move beyond simple prompt-response interactions and construct complex, dynamic workflows where intelligent agents collaborate, use tools, and adapt to intricate tasks.

quickstart.title: Quickstart
quickstart.description: Get up and running with TFrameX in 5 minutes! This guide will walk you through creating your first AI agent application.
